forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. Southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 55. West wind 9 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock strikes midnight, Downtown San Francisco finds itself nestled under a mantle of moisture, the air thickened with the promise of rain. The sky wears a mostly cloudy shroud, with temperatures subtly shifting from the cool grip of 49 to a mild 51. A gentle southwest breeze stirs, whispering tales of coming rain, its gusts flirting with the leaves as they dance amidst the shadows. An 80% chance of precipitation looms, hinting at a soft patter that may grace the streets as the night moves steadily into the dawn.

Looking ahead to the morrow, the rain is expected to linger, casting a possibly fleeting pall over the workday before yielding to moments of sun. The afternoon might reveal a tempered warmth, a high teasing toward 55 degrees as the west wind breathes life into the coolness, reaching speeds that might send stray papers skimming across the pavement. The likelihood of rain drops to 40% as the day unfolds, yet the ground may still bear the kiss of light drizzle, with fresh, new deposits that barely dampen the surface.

In such a climate, choosing to embrace comfort will serve you well. A resilient jacket to guard against the elements and a sturdy pair of shoes will keep you protected as you navigate the wet sidewalks. The enchanting chill might invite a warm beverage to sip, perhaps a rich coffee from a local café or a soothing tea to cradle in your hands as you stroll. With the streets softened by rain, this is a beautiful time for a visit to the nearby art galleries or a leisurely walk through the less-traveled paths in Golden Gate Park, where the earth soaks in the much-needed moisture, and the air sparkles with possibility.
